III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When Staff 1 wakes Youth A and Youth B up, he threatens to slap
them and beat them up. There is no information Staff 1 has ever
been physical with Youth A or Youth B. Youth A and Youth B are
afraid of Staff 1 and have been going AWOL due to the threats.
Youth A and Youth B are currently AWOL. Staff 2 dragged Youth
A out of bed by his arms and told youth to go AWOL if they do not
like it at the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 2/28/25. Complainant
did not provide additional information regarding the complaint.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Youth A reported he did not know if
he had any issues with Staff 1. Youth A reported he went AWOL
with Youth B because he was tired of being in the facility. Youth A
said he was tired of staff waking him up so early. Youth A reported
he did not remember who the staff was waking him up. Youth A
then reported that Staff 1 was previously waking him up and did
not remember who was doing it now. Youth A denied he was ever
threatened by a staff to get him to wake up. Youth A reported that
one female staff tried to pull him out of bed by grabbing his hands.
Youth A denied knowing who the female staff was and stated that
she is not there anymore. Youth A was not able to report when
this occurred. Youth A denied any knowledge if Staff 1 ever did or
said anything inappropriate including threats to other youth
including Youth B. Youth A reported staff will tell youth that they
will pull you out of bed if you do not get up and reported that today
a staff pulled him out of bed. Youth A reported that Staff 2 told him
to just go AWOL if he did not like it there. Youth A denied that any
staff said they would beat him up or slap him. Youth A denied
having any marks or injuries. Youth A reported that Youth E
threatened him and hit him and that his nose was bleeding. Youth
A reported this altercation occurred this morning in his bedroom.
Youth A reported that his nose was looked at for medical attention
after the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Staff 2 denied ever threatening any
of the youth at the facility. Staff 2 denied ever threatening Youth A
or youth B. Staff 2 denied telling any youth including Youth A or
Youth B to go AWOL if they do not like it at the facility. Staff 2
reported when providing verbal de-escalation to youth she will tell
them she can only keep them safe if they remain here and
encourages them to stay. Staff 2 denied hearing any staff
threatening youth or telling them to go AWOL. Staff 2 reported she
was not present when Youth A got into the altercation that
2

morning with Youth E. Staff 2 reported to wake youth up in the
morning staff will request supervisor assistance if they refuse to
wake up. Staff 2 reported that staff do not touch youth when
attempting to wake them up. Staff 2 denied hearing of any other
staff threatening youth in any way to get them to get out of bed or
touching them in any way to get them to wake up including pulling
their arms, or mattress. Staff 2 reported Youth A has been acting
different since the arrival of Youth B, elaborating that prior to
Youth B’s arrival, Youth A was compliant and positive and now he
goes AWOL with Youth B and has a negative attitude.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Youth C reported there was a fight
between Youth A and Youth E this morning. Youth C reported he
was on the same floor and overheard Youth E telling Youth A to
wake up. Youth C reported he heard Youth A yelling and saying
that staff were flipping his mattress to get him up, but they were
not doing that, they were not even in the room. Youth C reported
he could see that staff were not in the room because he was in the
hallway with the staff at the time. Youth C reported he knew
something happened to make Youth A’s nosebleed because he
saw his nose bleeding however, he did not see Youth A being hit
as he went into the bathroom during the altercation. Youth C
reported staff do not pull youth out of their beds or touch their
mattresses. Youth C reported they do not touch kids when trying
to wake them up and if the kids will not get up they ask a
supervisor to help and they will just flip the light on and keep
asking them to get out of bed. Youth C reported he has never
seen a staff threaten or touch Youth A. Youth C denied Staff 1
ever threatening or touching any youth including Youth A. Staff 1
reported he does not have any issues or concerns with Staff 1,
Staff 2, or any of the staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Staff 1 reported he has never
threatened any youth at the facility. Staff 1 stated to wake up the
youth in the morning they verbally ask them to wake up and they
do not touch the youth, or their beds in any way. Staff 1 reported if
the youth do not get up right away, they may turn the light on or he
will start to joke around with them and talk about breakfast being
ready. Staff 1 denied ever witnessing or knowledge of any other
staff including Staff 2 pulling Youth A or any other youth out of
their beds. Staff 1 reported Youth B once told him that he was
going to get him fired. Staff 1 reported he is currently on a safety
plan not to work in the same area as Youth A due to the
allegation. Staff 1 reported he was not present that morning for the
altercation between Youth A and Youth E.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Staff 3 reported she could hear the
incident that morning between Youth A and Youth E but did not
have a visual as she was on the other end of the hall. Staff 3
reported to wake youth up in the morning staff will verbally tell
them to wake up and will continue to ask them if they do not wake
up right away. Staff 3 denied any other touching occurs than a
light tap on the shoulder. Staff 3 denied any knowledge or
witnessing of Staff 1 or Staff 2 doing anything else to wake up
youth including threatening them, grabbing them, or touching their
mattresses. Staff 3 denied ever hearing a staff including Staff 2 tell
youth to go AWOL if they do not like it there.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Staff 4 reported she was present
that morning on the second floor while waking youth up. Staff 4
reported Youth E walked over to Youth A’s bedroom telling him to
get up when Youth A was not getting up for staff. Staff 4 reported
Youth E was upset that Youth A would not get up because it
causes the rest of the youth to be delayed in getting hygiene done
and ready for breakfast. Staff 4 reported she tried to wake up
Youth A that morning by going to his doorway and calling his
name and in response Youth A was yelling and cursing. Staff 4
reported Youth A was yelling that staff were trying to pull his
mattress and that someone was pulling him but it was not true as
no staff were in the room. Staff 4 reported at this point they
reported to a supervisor that they were struggling to get Youth A
out of bed. Staff 4 said at this time Youth E was standing in the
hallway and began to argue with Youth A then heard the fight start
so the staff went to separate the boys. Staff 4 reported she, Staff
3, and Staff 5 were working to de-escalate the situation using
verbal re-direction. Staff 4 reported Staff 5 was working to
separate the boys while she eventually got Youth E to come with
her away from the area. Staff 4 reported Youth A was sent to the
hospital as his nose was bleeding. Staff 4 denied seeing the strike
that led to the nosebleed but knew a fight started because of the
commotion. Staff 4 denied any witnessing of or knowledge of any
staff including Staff 1 and Staff 2 had ever threatened Youth A to
get them out of bed or tell any youth to go AWOL if they did not
like it there.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Youth E reported Youth A was
being disrespectful to staff by saying staff were trying to drag
Youth A out of bed when they were not doing that. Youth E
reported he knew the staff were not doing that because he could
see the staff were outside the door and staff would not do that.
Youth E reported he told Youth A to get up and Youth A told Youth
4

E to shut up at which point Youth E walked into the room and
Youth A threw a shoe at him, so Youth E hit Youth A a couple of
times. Youth E reported staff were in the hall waking up other
youth and came to break it up when they heard. Youth E reported
once Youth A threw the shoe he then punched Youth A, Youth A
punched back, and then Youth E punched Youth A in the face,
causing his nose to bleed. Youth E reported staff never pulled any
youth out of bed and that Youth A was making things up. Youth E
reported he never heard of a staff doing anything but tell them to
get up and turn the lights on to get up. Youth E denied knowledge
or witnessing any staff touching any youth or their beds in any way
to get them to get out of bed. Youth E denied staff ever
threatening him or any other youth or telling any youth to go
AWOL if they do not like it there.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Youth F reported he knew that
Youth E punched Youth A in the nose because he was not
listening to staff. Youth F reported he did not witness the
altercation. Youth F reported that to wake up youth staff will knock
on their door and say it is time to get up. Youth F reported that he
has never heard of Staff 1 or Staff 2 threatening youth in any way,
pulling them out of bed, or telling youth to go AWOL if they do not
like here.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/28/25
along with MDHHS specialist. Staff 5 reported they were short
staffed as 3 women were on the second floor and there should
have been a male. Staff 5 reported Staff 4 attempted to wake up
Youth A. Staff 5 reported she heard Youth A say that Staff 4 was
attempting to drag him out of the bed but she knew that was not
true. Staff 5 reported staff were not in his room but walking the
halls to wake up youth. Staff 5 reported Youth E said for Youth A
to “get his ass up.” Staff 5 reported she heard the fight start and
she and the other staff began to attempt verbal redirection and
separating the youth. Staff 5 reported she could not see well
because she did not have her glasses on and grabbed another
staff by mistake and could not see what was going on. Staff 5
reported that after the altercation, Youth A’s nose was bleeding,
and the incident was reported to administration. Staff 5 reported
that Youth A was sent to the hospital.
Video Review:
Video Footage dated 2/28/25. Video footage was reviewed. Video
footage does not show a visual to Youth A’s bedroom and
therefore does not show the altercation or attempts to wake up
Youth A.
5

Documentation Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 2/28/25 detailed the altercation
between Youth A and Youth E stating that Youth E
approached Youth A in his bedroom not following staff
directions to get out of bed, Youth A threw a shoe at Youth
E and punches were thrown between them resulting in
Youth A having a bloody nose.
• Ascension St. John Hospital Discharge Instructions dated
2/28/2025 details hospital visit for Youth A following the
physical altercation resulting in a bloody nose.
Documentation reflects a nasal contusion with instructions
for pain management.
Analysis A violation is not established regarding this allegation. Staff and
Youth consistently denied concerns with Staff 1 including Staff 1
threatening youth. It was consistently denied by youth interviewed
that any youth were fearful of Staff 1. Further, interview with Youth
A was inconsistent with regards to concerns noted in the
allegation.
A violation is not established regarding additional allegations that
Staff 2 pulled Youth A out of bed by his wrists and Staff 2 telling
youth to go AWOL if they do not like it there. These allegations
were consistently denied by Staff and Youth. Further, it was
determined that Staff 2 was not on the floor the morning of 2/28/25
and it was denied that any other staff dragged Youth A out of bed.
Consultation:
Consultation was provided to the Chief Administrator regarding
interview with Staff 5. Consultant addressed the concern with Staff
5 engaging in work duties without her glasses and her limited
vision causing her to be unable to see who she was attempting to
redirect. It was also discussed that this staff may need training
regarding ratio requirements as she reported believing male staff
were required.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
